Key Arguments: The legislation risks leading to authoritarianism by allowing the government to censor perceived misinformation.
Defining misinformation is subjective and can lead to the suppression of legitimate alternative viewpoints.
Censorship undermines freedom of speech and open debate, which are essential for democracy.
Censorship can backfire, leading to the Streisand Effect and reinforcing misinformation beliefs.
Fear of censorship can create a chilling effect on free expression.
Censorship is ineffective and can erode trust in government institutions.
Preservation of free speech is crucial for a democratic society.
Notable Quotes: The truth does not mind being questioned only lies need opposing views to be silenced!
A government that censors perceived misinformation risks becoming an information gatekeeper.
Censorship often backfires, leading to Streisand Effect.
We want less government in our lives not more!
